channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Biden to Netanyahu over Gaza conflict: 'Urgency of bringing ceasefire and hostage release deal to closure'
item.description: President Biden discussed with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu about a cease-fire in Gaza, highlighting its urgency. They aimed to address obstacles in upcoming Cairo talks involving the US, Israel, Egypt, and Qatar. Biden remains committed to a cease-fire despite Hamas backing off, while challenges remain around Israeli troop presence in key Gaza corridors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Should I get personal?': Trump fires back at Obamas for DNC attacks, says former president 'was very nasty’
item.description: Former President Donald Trump responded to criticisms from Barack and Michelle Obama during the Democratic National Convention. Trump, at a rally in Asheboro, North Carolina, accused the Obamas of personal attacks and asked supporters if he should respond in kind. Despite advice to focus on policy, Trump questioned whether to stick to this approach.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘American Airlines didn’t care’: Albany exec Dan McCoy misses DNC flight over chicken sandwich, tries to use status to board
item.description: Albany County Executive Dan McCoy tried to use his political influence to board an American Airlines flight after missing his boarding call while getting Chick-fil-A. Despite mentioning his title, the airline staff did not reopen the doors. McCoy and a staffer later booked a different flight. No public funds were used for the trip, said McCoy’s spokesperson.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: DNC Day 3: Over 1,000 protesters gather in Chicago, police presence strong amid rising clashes
item.description: On the third night of the Democratic National Convention, over 1,000 pro-Palestinian protesters gathered in Union Park while pro-Israel demonstrators assembled near the United Center. Despite a heavy police presence, the gatherings remained mostly peaceful, although minor injuries and arrests occurred. Green Party candidate Jill Stein criticized the police response, while Police Superintendent Larry Snelling defended the actions taken.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Musk's Neuralink says second trial implant went well, no thread retraction issue
item.description: Elon Musk's Neuralink has made progress with its brain implant technology, designed to aid paralyzed patients in controlling digital devices via thought. In a second trial, patient Alex showed no thread retraction issues unlike the first patient. The device has allowed users to interact with technology in ways like playing video games and 3D designing.

item.title: Hindu Priest Rakesh Bhatt opens DNC Day 3 with 'Om Shanti': Watch as 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' resonates in Chicago
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: DNC Day 3: Complete schedule and IST timings
item.description: The Democratic National Convention in Chicago released the speaker list for its third day, headlined by former President Bill Clinton and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz. The event will start at 4:00 am IST, showcasing prominent Democrats like Senator Cory Booker and anticipated appearances from Oprah Winfrey. The theme is "A Fight for Our Freedoms."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Queen Elizabeth II found Trumps to be 'Gracious' guests, says Palace official

item.title: Judicial strikes grow in Mexico over reform pushing currency lower
Maggots were released into DNC breakfast, FBI investigates how
item.description: ​Maggots were found in the breakfast service of the Democratic National Convention Wednesday morning following which the FBI launched an investigation to find out whether this was an activism-related incident. Fairmont Chicago hotel spokesperson Haley Robles confirmed to news outlets that a group of individuals caused a disruption at a DNC-related breakfast event at the hotel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Top US oilfield firm Halliburton hit by cyberattack
At least 55 arrested after clashes with police outside Israeli Consulate in Chicago during DNC
item.description: At least 55 protesters were arrested in Chicago following violent clashes with police during the Democratic National Convention. Demonstrations focused on opposing the Israel-Hamas war, with intense confrontations near the Israeli Consulate. Chicago Police Superintendent Larry Snelling described the situation as a danger to the city, emphasizing the efforts made to de-escalate the conflict.

item.title: US job growth lower than estimated by 818,000, reveals revised data
item.dc:creator: TOI Business Desk

item.title: American Airlines passenger bleeds from hair transplant surgery, arrested for refusing to deboard
item.description: ​​A Las Vegas couple was arrested from an American Airlines plane after their resistance to deboard the plane when the flight crew asked them to do so as the man was profusely bleeding from his head. The bleeding was because of a hair transplant surgery and the man said he did not have a fresh bandage to cover his head. All passengers had to be deplaned and the flight was delayed as the couple said it they could not fly, no one else would either.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden to speak with Netanyahu on Gaza ceasefire talks, US official says
Donald Trump's son says he'd love to give a '3-letter agency' to RFK Jr
item.description: Amid speculations that independent candidate Robert F Kennedy Jr will drop out of the race and support Donald Trump if he gets a position in the administration, Trump Jr said he would love the idea of putting RFK Jr in charge of a three-letter agency and let him "blow it up".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Thai man kills 12-foot python after it bites him on testicles in toilet

item.title: US Congressman Bill Pascrell dies at 87, announce family on social media

item.title: Trump says he's happy for his role in Joe Biden's 'demise': 'Good news is...'
item.description: As the Democrats eviscerated Donald Trump at the ongoing national convention in Chicago, the former president Wednesday began his day with a long rant against 'Comrade Kamala Harris, 'Barrack Hussain Obama', 'Crazy Nancy Pelosi', 'Lightweight movie state George Clooney' and 'Crooked Joe'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
